value.description:
Vampires are a type of archotech-enhanced xenohuman. Powered by archites, their abilities go far beyond normal genetic enhancements. They are mentally adept and supernaturally beautiful. In combat, they can launch deadly spines and heal injured friends. They don't age or die naturally and never suffer from disease or poison. A vampire can make a new vampire by reimplanting their own xenogerm into a person.

Vampires must regularly consume human blood, and they must periodically enter torpor for long periods. They're easily destroyed by fire, and slowed down by UV light.

The first vampire appeared thousands of years ago when the lord-explorer Varan-Dur sought to control a hyperintelligent archotech and found himself transformed by it instead. Every vampire is descended from him. Since then, vampires have often been hunted because of their destabilizing power and their need for blood. Since they can pass for baseliners, many live in hiding among typical humans.

Their numbers are unknown. Some think they are legends or rare irrelevancies. Some believe vampires secretly direct entire human civilizations. The stories speak of eternal lords ruling billions from slate-black space stations, or directing blood sacrifices at conferences in the underlayers of the deepest urbworlds.

value.descriptionShort: Vampires are ageless, deathless super-humans powered by archotech-created archites in the bloodstream. They are beautiful and extremely intelligent. They can heal any injury, and never suffer from disease or poison. In combat, they can launch deadly spines and heal injured friends. The price is that vampires must consume human blood to survive, and they must periodically enter torpor for long periods. They're easily destroyed by fire, and slowed down by UV light.

questDescription->A vampire named [asker_nameDef] is looking for a safe place to meet with [sanguophageCountMinusOne] other [sanguophageSingOrPlural] where they won't be tracked. Their leader [asker_nameDef] is asking for you to host the meeting at [map_definite].

If you accept, [sanguophageCount] vampires will arrive at [map_definite] from different directions. They will spend several hours discussing their own secret issues before departing. They promise to give you your reward before they leave.

You may betray the vampires and attack them. Downed vampires can be forced to turn one of your own colonists into a vampire.

value.description: When a dark stranger offered you a cure for your cancer, you were ready to agree to anything. He made you into a vampire - an immortal blood-drinker hated by a thousand religions. You hid your condition for years, but eventually a hunter tracked you down. Stowing away on the first starship leaving the system, you barely escaped alive.\n\nNote: Vampires have unique strengths and weaknesses, which makes this a difficult scenario.

value.summary: One crashlanded vampire needing blood to survive, and one human colonist.

value.customSummary: Start with one adult or child vampire and one other colonist of any age.

value.description: non-baby vampire

A specially-treated wooden torch that produces a red light over a large area. Vampires gather around torches like these during their ceremonial meetings. The sanguine glow is particularly pleasing to individuals with the bloodfeeder gene. It can be automatically refueled with wood, and produces a small amount of heat.
Carriers have special vampirically blood-powered muscle fibers in their legs which allow them to jump great distances.
Carriers of this gene have small retractable fangs. They can bite an unresisting person, and drink their blood directly.
Carriers grow an opening in their upper chest along with a quiver of keratin spines. Using vampiric power, they can fire these spines at high speed at nearby targets with surprising accuracy.

Carriers of this gene must periodically regenerate themselves in a special coma called torpor. Torpor takes days, but can confer substantial bonuses. Torpor can be accelerated and its effects enhanced by the use of a variety of special buildings and technologies.\n\nThose who put off torpor will suffer from torpor exhaustion.

Carriers of this gene have a reserve of biological strength powered by blood. The resource can be gained and spent in various ways, all of which are unlocked by other genes.\n\nCarriers lose 2 blood per day from biological entropy.

value.resourceDescription:
A reserve of biological strength which can be gained and spent in a variety of ways.

Blood can be increased by drinking from a human or consuming blood packs. You can obtain blood packs using the 'extract blood pack' medical operation on a non-vampiric human.

If blood reaches zero, {PAWN_nameDef} will become very unhappy.

value.description: Carriers lose an additional 8 blood per day from biological entropy.

A deep coma-like sleep that lasts several days and restores the body's resources. Certain genes create a need for torpor. Torpor can also be enhanced with various support buildings that give special bonuses to the sleeper.
Torpor was interrupted while this person's metabolism was still out of balance. They will be sick for days while regaining equilibrium.
This person desperately needs to enter torpor to rebalance their metabolism.
Due to a lack of blood, this person's body is breaking down their own bone marrow. This causes disorientation and a painful craving for human blood.
All blood gains are multiplied up because this person used a blood amplifier while in torpor. This effect lasts until the next torpor.
Move speed is increased because this person used a glucosoid pump while in torpor. This effect lasts until the next torpor.
Psychic sensitivity is enhanced because this person used a psychofluid pump while in torpor. This effect lasts until the next torpor.

Wardens will ignore this prisoner. When a vampire's blood levels are low, they may feed on this prisoner. Other prisoners who are vampires can also feed on this prisoner, if they are in the same cell.
An operation to extract blood packs will be automatically queued on this prisoner whenever it can be done without killing them. The operation will be carried out by a doctor.

Extract a blood pack from the target. The operation will fail to produce a blood pack if the target does not have enough blood.\n\nBlood packs can be administered to others to reduce blood loss or to satiate those who feed on blood.
Use blood packs to reduce the effects of blood loss. Each blood pack used recovers 35% blood loss. The operation will also restore blood supply to vampiric individuals.
A multiplier on the amount of blood gained when consuming blood from any source.

An enclosed med-casket that accelerates the process of torpor. It can connect to other devices which confer additional bonuses on the occupant. The number of devices that can connect depends on the person's torpor capacity, which can be seen by selecting them.\n\nOnly those with the torpor gene can use the torpor casket.

This blood-refining pump increases the amount of vampiric power a resting vampire can store in their body. It must be connected to a torpor casket to function.\n\nThis building needs to consume blood to function.

This device leaves a sleeper in a blood-amplified state so they gain more blood from any source. Using a gland probe and blood analyzer, it links with a person in torpor, stimulating their biology into a more active state. It must be connected to a torpor casket to function.\n\nThis building needs to consume blood to function.

This device allows a sleeper to move faster after torpor is complete. It pumps the body with extra muscle-signaling factors while cleaning waste products from muscle tissue. The effect lasts until the individual torpors again. It must be connected to a torpor casket to function.\n\nThis building must consume blood to function.

This device enhances the psychic sensitivity of a person in torpor by rhythmically stimulating neural tissues. It must be connected to a torpor casket to function.\n\nThis building must consume blood to function.

This device connects with a slumbering person and makes torpor complete quicker. It enhances the effect of the torpor casket using finer blood analysis and more powerful chemicals. It must be connected to a torpor casket to function.

A package of refined blood in a specialized container that prevents spoilage. Vampiric humans can consume it to restore their internal blood stores. It can be administered via an operation to reverse blood loss.
A serum that permanently increases the number of torpor buildings a person can connect to during torpor.\n\nThe serum can only be ingested by individuals with the torpor gene.

value.description: Those with the torpor gene must periodically undergo a special torpor that lasts several days. This research project allows you to construct buildings which accelerate the torpor and confer specific bonuses on the sleeper. Over time, you can build a grand torpor temple.

value.helpText:
Colonists with the torpor gene must periodically regenerate themselves in a special coma called torpor. This takes several days.

Special machines placed near the casket can give bonuses to the sleeper. A person can only connect to a limited number of machines - this number is shown by their torpor capacity.

You can increase torpor capacity by injecting torpor capacity serums. These can be purchased from traders.

value.description:
People with the torpor gene must torpor every few days or quadrums. To torpor means entering a regenerative coma for several days, during which the sleeper appears dead.

A variety of special buildings can connect to a person in torpor and give them bonuses upon waking.

Going too long without torpor will cause torpor exhaustion, which massively degrades a person's physical capacities.
